intro: Dimacria imbuta, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers with a distinctive cup-like shape. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and along watercourses. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
